author: Lucy Leeson
title: Trump appears to slurs words while speaking about drug death penalty | Flipboard
text: Former president Donald Trump appeared to slur his words while speaking on his campaign objective to mandate the death penalty for drug dealers. President Joe Biden’s 2024 campaign rolled out a series of videos featuring gaffes and nonsensical phrases from his Republican rival, adding fuel to the fire over concerns about the former president’s cognitive ability. One clip started mid-sentence, showing Mr Trump speaking in New Hampshire on Monday (22 January): “Which is incapable of solvin’ even the sollest… smallest problem. The simplest of problems we can no longer solve. “We are an institute in a powerful death penalty. We will put this on,” the 77-year-old Mr Trump blundered. author: JandroPV
title: #20 Fauna de Ferraz, la figura de acción
text:
Ostia. Decibelia, Capitán España, Hunger Strike... esto es oro puro!!!
#3 #1 falta el Qñao
#4 Error imperdonable
#6 #5 y falta el del menisco roto y la medium nazi
#7 Hostia, ya me pierdo. Es que a mí las series de zombis...
#8 Y todo superhéroe tiene a su mascota, como Batman tiene a Robin. Aquí falta Borja, que vino para Putodefender España!
#7 La del menisco roto puedes conseguirla tuneando un poco una figura de Markus Wulfhart.
#3 los quiero todos !!!
#3 ¿Qué tiene que ver Decibelia con Ferraz?
¿y los villanos para cuando? perroxanxe, el ministro lanzador de rayos marica, la imperdonable carmena...
Entre los heroes me falta el niñato aquel que salio a puto defender España y al final termino gaseao
#6 y la de las vacunas y los masones (el rey,uno de ellos , por eso calla)
#9 yo quiero la mujer del menisco
Lo iba a poner porque me salió en Linkedin (es obra de una agencia de publicidad y uno de los creativos es colega) pero no sé si se puede enlazar una web así a palo seco.
Mierda, quien me iba a decir que iba a querer muñequitos de fachas. Felicita a tu colega #1 por la idea, de primero de marketing, creando necesidades
#18 es para promocionar la agencia, y no, no le voy a felicitar por LinkedIn que yo trabajo en un entorno bastante distinto ahora.
Putovengadores...
¡Putocalla y putotoma mi dinero!
Ahora un poco en serio, si sacaran un juego de cartas, igual lo compraba en un momento de debilidad
Es que menudos personajes se juntan en Ferraz cada noche. Dan para meme casi todos.
Yo quiero a decibelia, pero se puede pedir que las patas las tenga ajustables? Es que si no no se aguanta encima del altavoz
#11 blutack
que liberen los .stl ya
#17 otro fundidor !
#17 ¡Si sacan los .stl me putocompro una impresora 3D ya!
Faltaría también el señor mayor que convocó la del último día del año para hacerle un favor a los pettitos voxeros.

author: AGDAILY Reporters
title: National Dairy Board opens up $31K worth of scholarships
text:
Applications are being accepted for college scholarships awarded by America’s dairy farmers and importers through the National Dairy Promotion and Research Board.
Eleven scholarships worth $2,500 each will be awarded, and one outstanding recipient will receive a $3,500 James H. Loper Jr. Memorial Scholarship. NDB funds, in part, Dairy Management Inc., which manages the national dairy checkoff program.
Undergraduate students in their sophomore through senior year for the 2024-25 academic school year and enrolled in college or university programs emphasizing dairy are eligible. Relevant majors may include communications/public relations, journalism, marketing, business, economics, nutrition, food science, and agriculture education.
Scholarships are awarded based on academic achievement, an interest in a career in a dairy-related discipline, and demonstrated leadership, initiative, and integrity. Candidates must complete an application form, submit an official transcript of all college courses, and write a short statement describing their career aspirations, dairy-related activities, and work experiences.
The application information is evaluated by an NDPRB Scholarship Committee composed of an external review panel and at least two Board members. The committee’s recommendations are summarized by NDPRB staff, and the scholarships are then awarded.
Students may be awarded scholarships in multiple years. Scholarship winners must be enrolled during the entire academic year for which the scholarship is awarded.
Applications can be
found here. Completed applications must be received no later than May 31, 2024, at 11:59 p.m. CST.
The winners will be announced to both the awardee and the university department chairperson later this fall. Scholarship winners will receive a swag pack and a check for the award amount. The stipend will be forwarded to the department head/chairperson for issuance to awardees upon enrollment for the fall 2023-2024 term.
»Related:
National DHIA selects winners for $14K in scholarships

organizations.name: national dairy promotion and research board

author: Print Content
title: Calvary Christian College hosts successful Endemic Science Expo | Southern Courier
text:
The Calvary Christian College Science Department recently hosted its third successful Endemic Science Expo.
Endemic in this context means learners identify a problem within a 5km radius of their school and develop a scientific solution using one of the sciences studied at school – earth sciences (geography), biological science (life science), or physical science.
This approach helps learners apply their knowledge to real-world issues, demonstrating the practical value of their studies.
Two distinguished guests and judges, Professor Oupa Mashile from Unisa and Mary Williams, central regional director of ISASA, were present to interact with learners and provide valuable feedback on their projects.
Learners demonstrate how their science project works to a guest. The Endemic Science Expo provides budding scientists a platform to showcase their talents and innovations, offering practical solutions to challenges faced by their communities.
Science teacher and expo organiser, Mr Muleya, said: “This talent would remain hidden unless we provide a platform for these young minds to grow and develop their inquisitiveness. We need to support these young people so their creative ideas do not go to waste but become meaningful solutions.”
Participants included young scientists from schools such as St Mary’s (Waverley), Broadacres, and Calvary Christian College itself. Many focused on addressing basic resource needs in informal settlements around Gauteng, such as access to clean water and electricity.
Oarabile Nkabinde from Calvary Christian College and her winning exhibit. The winning project, by Grade Nine learner Oarabile Nkabinde from Calvary Christian College, detailed scientific methods for harvesting and filtering water to make it accessible to communities. The project demonstrated an impressive understanding of the role of science in society, earning well-deserved praise from the school.
Learners from several schools also attended to view exhibits and exchange ideas with the participants.
Calvary Christian College expressed heartfelt gratitude to their major sponsors, Voltex and MajorTech, for their generous ongoing support. Thanks were also extended to Mobile Gals and the school’s head boy parents for contributing to the event’s success.
For more information or to register for next year’s event, schools can email principal@calvarychristiancollege.co.za .
